Name: Issue 294
Introduction: Howdy Everyone, So much great content in this edition of WeeklyXamarin.  Sorry for the late publish, but it takes time to parse all this great information.  Hope you have had a great weekend and welcome to February. ❤ Kym

Articles.Title: .NET FrontEnd Day
Articles.Description: Check out the recordings from .NET Frontend Day - A full day online, with focus on building frontend applications using .NET!
Articles.Author: Dotnet FrontEnd

Articles.Title: Xamarin Community Toolkit
Articles.Description: The Xamarin Community Toolkit complements Xamarin.Forms 5 perfectly with all kinds of commonly found behaviors, converters, effects, MVVM utilities, and awesome new controls including the CameraView, AvatarView, and TabView.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: iOS14 UIDatePicker
Articles.Description: Steven looks at the different UIDatePicker options in iOS14 and how you can use custom renderers to allow selecting your preferred type of UIDatePicker.
Articles.Author: Steven Thewissen

Articles.Title: Custom Radio Buttons
Articles.Description: The RadioButton control is a lovely addition to Xamarin.Forms. Even though it looks great, there are probably going to be times when you will want to customise it.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: MvvmCross & Separate Tablet UI
Articles.Description: How to make separate View’s for Tablet, Phones, Desktops and other device families with MvvmCross
Articles.Author: Bohdan Benetskyi

Articles.Title: Don’t use CollectionView inside a ScrollView
Articles.Description: A timely reminder from Luis about why you shouldn't be putting your CollectionView inside a ScrollView.
Articles.Author: Luis Matos

Articles.Title: Filtering and sorting with Dynamic Data in Xamarin Forms (Part 2)
Articles.Description: How to filter and sort your data when using the SearchBar in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Author: Rendy Del Rosario

Articles.Title: Replicating Talent Casting UI in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: A nice UI design implemented in Xamarin.Forms.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Fancy Frame
Articles.Description: Fancy Frame is a reimplementation of PancakeView done using Skiasharp which runs on all Xamarin.Forms platforms.  So if you need fancy frames on Tizen, this is for you.
Articles.Author: Yuriy Holembyovskyy

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Essentials App Actions
Articles.Description: Xamarin.Essentials provides developers with cross-platform APIs for their mobile applications. On this week's Essential API of the week we take a look at App Actions, that allows you to add shortcuts to your app icons to launch your users into specific parts of your app.
Articles.Author: The Xamarin Show

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 238: Island Tracker - The Final Chapter
Articles.Description: We have come to the epic conclusion of James's app Island Tracker, his Animal Crossing app for tracking turnip prices with friends. He is ready to roll out his freemium version of the app while upgrading all of his existing customers and updating the backend.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: Introducing the Xamarin Community Toolkit
Articles.Description: The Xamarin Community Toolkit is a collection of Animations, Behaviors, Converters, Effects and even controls for mobile development with Xamarin.Forms. In this episode, Gerald has Javier on from the Xamarin.Forms team to give us an overview of what you can expect from the Xamarin Community Toolkit. He shows us samples from the sample app, how to implement a thing or two and even how to start contributing yourself!
Articles.Author: The Xamarin Show

Articles.Title: Live App Store Optimization Q&A
Articles.Description: App Store Optimization Q&A Session with AppFigures ASO expert, answering a variety if questions from the audience, ranging from the simple basics to advanced topics.
Articles.Author: Ariel Michaeli

Articles.Title: TestFlight - How to Upload and Distribute Your App
Articles.Description: This video walks through uploading your app for beta testing on Test Flight. We walk thought creating an App ID, registering with the App Store, archiving and uploading your build and distributing the app to your beta testers via email and a public link.
Articles.Author: Sean Allen

Articles.Title: Take Partial Screenshots of Your Xamarin.Forms App
Articles.Description: Gerald shows how to make screenshots of just a part of your screen. He found a library that can take a VisualElement and make an image out of that.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Null Pointers 37: Bots
Articles.Description: The idea of being able to have a conversation with our computing devices is nothing new. Going down memory lane to early IRC days all the way back to the present using AI to try and pass the Turing Test. In this episode we discuss our experiences, opinions and give our best Bot beep impression.
Articles.Author: Null Pointers

Articles.Title: Drawing Polygons in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: It's probably not often you need to draw a polygon, but when you do it's nice to know Xamarin.Forms 5 has primitive shapes at your fingertips. If you know the size of your visual need, that's great. But what do you do when you don't know the dimensions of the screen that your app is running on? This video shows you how to easily handle both cases.
Articles.Author: David Ortinau

Articles.Title: Input Validation in Xamarin.Forms with Xamarin.CommunityToolkit
Articles.Description: Validating input is an important task! With the Xamarin Community Toolkit this has never been easier to implement. If you're using XAML, you don't even need to write code! You can validate anything with a regular expression, or use the built-in URL, email or required string validator.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis
